title: Quinoa risotto with pumpkin and spinach
description: Try our gluten-free risotto recipe made with butternut squash, quinoa and lots of fresh herbs.
ingredients: ½ small butternut squash, peeled and cut into 2.5cm pieces
1 tbsp chopped fresh herbs, such as rosemary, oregano and thyme

method.Step 1: Heat the oven to 200°C/fan180°C/gas 6. Put the squash in a baking tray and roast for 30 minutes, turning halfway through.

method.Step 2: Meanwhile make the risotto. Heat the olive oil in a large, wide saucepan over a low-medium heat, then fry the onion and garlic for 5 minutes or until the onion is translucent, stirring often.

method.Step 3: Clear one side of the pan and add the quinoa. Stir the quinoa in its half of the pan for 1 minute or until slightly crisp, then stir to combine with the onion and garlic.

method.Step 4: Increase the heat and add the hot vegetable stock or water 1 ladleful at a time, stirring constantly, letting the quinoa mixture absorb each ladleful before adding the next (this should take around 10 minutes).

method.Step 5: Add the chopped tomatoes, herbs, sea salt, lemon zest, 2 tbsp lemon juice and cider vinegar to the risotto. Cook for a further 10 minutes or until the quinoa is tender but still slightly al dente.

method.Step 6: Stir through the spinach and roasted pumpkin, then cook for 5 minutes more. Taste and season with salt, black pepper and extra lemon juice, if required, then serve.
